thread.title: BREAKING: Long-term immigration to UK hits lowest for more than two years
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Long-term immigration to UK hits lowest for more than two years

title: BREAKING: Long-term immigration to UK hits lowest for more than two years
text:
BREAKING: Long-term immigration to UK hits lowest for more than two years BREAKING: Long-term immigration to UK hits lowest for more than two years Estimated net long-term international migration to the UK was 273,000 in the year to September - the lowest for more than two years, official figures show. PUBLISHED: 09:43, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 09:49, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 Getty The Home Office has released the latest immigration figures 
The figures from the Office of National Statistics are the first estimates covering a period including several weeks after the EU referendum. 
The last set of statistics showed net migration was running at a near record level of 335,000 in the year to the end of June. 
That was well above the Government's controversial target of less than 100,000, and this aim will fall under the spotlight once more with the latest publication.
